title: Maleic anhydride derivatives as catalysts for N-oxidation of pyridine using hydrogen peroxide
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,31657-31662
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA05962J, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Ghellyn Gajeles, Kyung-Koo Lee, Sang Hee Lee
The anhydride–diacid equilibrium is crucial for the catalytic cycle of maleic anhydride derivatives in N-oxidation of pyridine derivatives with H2O2. This catalytic system can replace stoichiometric peracids, such as m-CPBA, as oxidants.
